questions.question: What is the chemical formula of the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer discussed?
questions.answer: {[Zn(BBDF)(ATP)]·2DMF·3H2O}n

questions.question: What method was used to synthesize the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer?
questions.answer: Solvo-thermal method

questions.question: What is the detection limit of Hg2+ ions for the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer?
Does the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer show good water stability?
questions.answer: Yes, it exhibits good water stability at different pH values of 3–13.

questions.question: What is the main mechanism for the fluorescence quenching of Hg2+ ions by the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer?
questions.answer: Weak interaction between the Hg2+ and the framework structure

questions.question: Can the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer selectively detect Cr2O7 2- and CrO4 2- ions?
questions.answer: Yes, it can selectively detect Cr2O7 2- and CrO4 2- ions.

questions.question: What is the limit of detection for Cr2O7 2- ions by the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer?
Is the fluorescence quenching mechanism for antibiotics NFZ and NFT by the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer attributed to competitive absorption?
questions.answer: Yes, the fluorescence quenching mechanism for NFZ and NFT is attributed to competitive absorption.

questions.question: What is the detection limit of NFZ by the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer?
Does the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer have good recyclability for detecting Hg2+ ions?
questions.answer: Yes, it has excellent stability and remarkable recyclability for detecting Hg2+ ions.

questions.question: What is the role of the uncoordinated –NH2 group in the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer?
questions.answer: The uncoordinated –NH2 group increases the complexation affinity towards soft acid Hg2+ ions due to a soft acid–soft base interaction.

questions.question: What is the detection limit for NFT by the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer?
Can the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer be used repeatedly for the highly selective and sensitive luminescence detection of Cr2O7 2- ions?
questions.answer: Yes, it can be used repeatedly for the highly selective and sensitive luminescence detection of Cr2O7 2- ions.

questions.question: What is the main mechanism for the fluorescence quenching of antibiotics NFZ and NFT by the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer?
questions.answer: The fluorescence quenching mechanism is mainly attributed to the energy transfer and the competitive absorption mechanism.

questions.question: Is the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer capable of fast detection of Hg2+, CrVI, and antibiotics?
questions.answer: Yes, it is capable of fast detection of Hg2+, CrVI, and antibiotics.

questions.question: What is the detection limit of CrO4 2- ions by the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer?
Does the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer exhibit a fluorescence turn-off sensing behavior for Hg2+ ions?
questions.answer: Yes, it exhibits a fluorescence turn-off sensing behavior for Hg2+ ions.

questions.question: What is the role of the electrostatic surface potential (ESP) analysis in understanding the interaction between the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer and Hg2+ ions?
questions.answer: The ESP analysis helps in understanding the most favorable potential binding sites between the active electronegative nitrogen atom and Hg2+ ions.

questions.question: What is the role of the amino group in the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer's ability to detect Hg2+ ions?
questions.answer: The amino group acts as a soft base and increases the complexation affinity towards the soft acid Hg2+ ions due to a soft acid–soft base interaction.

questions.question: Is the Zn(II)-based luminescent coordination polymer synthesized using a flame-dried Schlenk flask?
questions.answer: Yes, it is synthesized using a flame-dried Schlenk flask.
